articles.author: Paritosh Bansal, Lananh Nguyen, Davide Barbuscia
articles.description: Industrial and Commercial Bank of China injected capital into its U.S. unit to help pay BNY Mellon (BK.N) $9 billion for unsettled trades and hired a cybersecurity firm to enable it to resume normal business after a ransomware attack, sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: ICBC puts capital into US unit, seeks cyber review after hack

articles.author: Makiko Yamazaki, Yuka Obayashi
articles.description: Japan's Cosmo Energy Holdings (5021.T) could struggle to win shareholder backing for a revised "poison pill" strategy, its chief executive said on Friday, as the company seeks to defend itself from activist investors pursuing a hostile takeover.
articles.title: Japan's Cosmo braces for 'poison pill' anti-activist vote

articles.author: David Lawder, Ann Saphir
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Friday said the U.S. government had seen evidence that Chinese firms may be aiding in the flow of equipment to Russia's war effort despite Western sanctions, and said she had urged China to crack down.
articles.title: Yellen warns Beijing: Chinese firms aiding Russia face 'significant consequences'

articles.author: Tom Polansek
articles.description: The United States is importing record amounts of beef this year and exporting less after ranchers slashed the nation's cattle herd to its lowest level in decades, tightening margins for meat companies like Tyson Foods (TSN.N).
articles.title: US reduces beef exports as cattle herd shrinks, squeezing Tyson Foods

articles.author: Valerie Volcovici, Kate Abnett
articles.description: More than 60 countries have said they back a deal spearheaded by the European Union, United States and United Arab Emirates to triple renewable energy this decade and shift away from coal, two officials familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Over 60 countries back deal to triple renewable energy this decade -officials

articles.author: Krystal Hu
articles.description: Alphabet's (GOOGL.O) Google is in talks to invest hundreds of millions of dollars in Character.AI, as the fast growing artificial intelligence chatbot startup seeks capital to train models and keep up with user demand, two sources briefed on the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Google in talks to invest in AI startup Character.AI -sources

articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.description: U.S. companies are set for their biggest year-over-year gain in quarterly earnings since the second quarter of 2022 after a high percentage of S&P 500 companies beat Wall Street expectations.
articles.title: US company earnings set for biggest quarterly gain in over a year

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel faced mounting international pressure, including from its main ally the United States, to do more to protect Palestinian civilians in Gaza as the death toll rose and fighting intensified between Israeli forces and Hamas militants near and around hospitals.
articles.title: As Gaza death toll rises, Israel faces pressure to protect Palestinian civilians

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Reuters documented more than 600 workplace injuries at SpaceX. Employees say they’re paying the price for Elon Musk’s push to reach Mars at breakneck speed.
articles.title: At SpaceX, worker injuries soar in Elon Musk’s rush to Mars

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a missile attack on Ukraine's capital Kyiv and the nearby region for the first time in weeks on Saturday and pounded the east and south of the country with drones, Ukrainian officials said.
articles.title: Russia renews missile attacks on Kyiv, pounds Ukraine's east and south
